Karhutla di OKI Sumsel Tak Kunjung Padam, Warga Dievakuasi
05 Nov 2019, 11:32 by Raja Adil Siregar
Ogan Komering Ilir - Kebakaran hutan dan lahan (Karhutla) di Ogan Komering Ilir (OKI), Sumatera Selatan, tak kunjung padam dan menyebabkan kabut asap pekat. Warga yang rumahnya berada di dekat lokasi karhutla pun harus dievakuasi.
Ada 73 orang warga Pacur Kelurahan Kedaton, Kayuagung, dievakuasi ke kantor Camat. Wakil Bupati Ogan Komering Ilir, Djakfar Shodiq, memastikan semua warga yang dievakuasi sejak Minggu (3/11) malam telah mendapat bantuan dan layanan kesehatan.
"Pelayanan dan kehadiran kita juga sangat diperlukan. Ini harus dipastikan," kata Shodiq saat mengunjungi warga Kayuagung, Selasa (4/11/2019).
Shodiq mengatakan kebakaran lahan di Sepucuk sedang berupaya dipadamkan oleh Satgas dari tim gabungan. Dia juga berharap hujan bisa segera turun untuk membantu pemadaman api.
"Semua upaya telah kita lakukan. Semua pihak bekerja maksimal dan disertai doa bersama turun hujan, apinya padam dan warga dapat kembali ke rumah," katanya.
Salah satu warga yang dievakuasi, Asnawati, mengatakan dia dan ketiga anaknya mengungsi karena asap pekat. Menurutnya, para pria di permukimannya masih berjaga di rumah dan membantu Satgas memadamkan api.
"Di sini ada ibu-ibu dan anak-anak, bapak-bapaknya berjaga di rumah dan sebagian bantu Satgas memadamkan api," terang Asnawati.

The Forestry and Fire in South Sumatra OKI Does Not Go Out, Residents Evacuated
05 Nov 2019, 11:32 by Raja Adil Siregar
Ogan Komering Ilir - Forest and land fires (Karhutla) in Ogan Komering Ilir (OKI), South Sumatra, were not extinguished and caused thick haze. Residents whose homes are near the site of the forest fire must be evacuated.
73 residents of Pacur Kelurahan Kedaton, Kayuagung, were evacuated to the Camat office. Deputy Regent of Ogan Komering Ilir, Djakfar Shodiq, ensured that all residents evacuated since Sunday (3/11) night had received assistance and health services.
"Our service and presence are also very necessary. This must be ensured," Shodiq said while visiting Kayuagung residents, Tuesday (11/04/2019).
Shodiq said the land fire in Sepucuk was being extinguished by the Task Force from the joint team. He also hopes the rain will fall soon to help put out the fire.
"All efforts have been made. All parties work optimally and accompanied by prayers together with rain, the fire is extinguished and residents can return home," he said.
One of the residents evacuated, Asnawati, said she and her three children were displaced due to heavy smoke. According to him, the men in his settlement were still standing guard at home and helped the Task Force put out the fire.
"Here there are mothers and children, their fathers stand guard at home and some help the Task Force put out the fire," explained Asnawati.
